posts.body:
>>8ee199cd-3079-4479-9c6a-256e6eb64d78
Using Tor Browser isn't enough to force ZeroNet to use Tor, by the way. As far as I can tell ZeroNet isn't going to look at TorBrowser's Tor connection because TB packs in its own Tor. You either need to configure a Tor connection separately from TB or configure ZN to use TB's same SOCKS proxy.

>>9610c855-1f22-464f-9b86-101e84df4dd2
Everybody should take a look at this: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/228

Like I said, you should be using TorBrowser, but just because you are using TorBrowser and connected to Tor does not mean ZeroNet is using Tor. You have to very deliberately set this up.

>>36ecb380-3d45-42c1-8026-efdaa77244cc
Dealing with your obviously massive autism is an essential part of self-improvement.
